translated: Essential Collection of Dharmas, Scroll 6
Compiled by the Venerable Avalokitavrata
Tripiá¹­aka Master from the Western Regions, Chao-san Ta-fu
All the karmic actions one creates, whether meritorious or not,
Can bind all sentient beings, each definitely attracting its own retribution.
The mind of the foolish is like a fish, abiding in the waves of craving,
Smiling while creating evil, crying and suffering oneself.
In the past, creating various offenses together, calling them servants and attendants,
Later, receiving the retribution of suffering, they will not be able to take each other's place.
Due to close relatives and friends, gathering to create various offenses,
In the next world, only the evil karma one has created will follow one.
Just as flowers go everywhere, their fragrance does not leave them,
So it is with good and evil karma, always following one wherever one goes.
Sentient beings are due to their own karma, the causes and effects always correspond,
Doing good leads to rebirth in the heavens, where one experiences supreme bliss.
If the fruits of evil karma, one will experience extremely heavy suffering,
Falling into the three evil destinies, that suffering has no parallel.
It is said that due to those three karmas, one creates and acts throughout the three realms,
Constantly giving rise to the three poisons, one then falls into the three evil paths.
All foolish ordinary beings, due to the convergence of causes and conditions,
Transmigrate within the three realms, all following their own karma;
What one creates oneself, one does not receive from others, what others create, one does not receive from oneself,
One should know that the karma one creates will definitely bring about its retribution.
Although there are many kinds of karma, there are nine realms where one experiences it,
Because they mutually assist each other, they form forty kinds of evil.
Creating a single karma oneself, one will definitely experience a single retribution,
Falling into the treacherous path, there is no companion.
Or for the sake of others, one may be exhorted to create evil karma,
But when one later receives the retribution of suffering, they will not be able to save you.
When karma ripens, it is neither the beginning nor the end, nor this life or another world,
It means that what is created here may be experienced elsewhere.
Due to good and evil karma, one follows the flow of transmigration,
Blown by the wind of karma, one attracts the retribution of suffering and joy.
The mind of the foolish is scattered, always delighting in desires,
Without the discernment of right wisdom, all evils then increase.
Those sentient beings attached to pleasure are covered by delusion,
Evil retribution appears before them, and they then fall into darkness.
Because of not giving rise to joy in the true Dharma of the Buddha,
In that hell, one will for a long time receive its suffering.
From beginningless cyclic existence, one is bound by the net of karma,
This cessation and that rebirth are all created by the mind.
Either falling from the heavens or from hell to the heavens,
Or reborn among humans, or experiencing the retribution of hungry ghosts;
It is said that the causes of suffering and happiness are all created by oneself,
Each giving rise to the other, not created by the god MaheÅ›vara.
In the cycle of birth and death, one creates countless evil karma,
Only the Buddha can fully understand, other wisdom cannot comprehend.
If non-dharma attracts goodness, this cause is inverted,
One should know that the fruits one receives are all similar to the causes.
If cause and effect correspond, then it accords with right principle,
All conditioned phenomena do not arise without conditions.
One has never seen a sinless person go to hell,
It is definitely due to evil karma that one then experiences its painful retribution.
Definitely committing various evils, firmly attached without regret,
Bound by karma, one then falls into the evil paths.
Never seen unwholesome karma leading to pleasant results,
Only the Buddha's true words show the counteractive path.
Like a lamp having light, like karma attracting retribution,
All that is done arises from causes and conditions.
That is to say, due to this and that cause, each fruit turns accordingly,
Thoroughly understanding such characteristics is called true insight.
Not the same as the self-existent god, established without cause,
All dharmas arise from conditions, this is what the Tathagata teaches.
Due to beginningless cyclic existence, karmic retribution is always similar,
Not inverted discrimination, arising from causes and conditions.
Sentient beings deluded by ignorance, insatiable in desire and lust,
If one does not understand karmic retribution, how can one attain tranquility?
If a person does not understand the path and what is not the path in the Buddha's teachings,
due to delusion and lack of right wisdom, they will always give rise to distress.
Seeing others' delightful experiences, that happiness arises from causes,
all phenomena are only mind, each according to one's own actions.
All conditioned things are impermanent, like water bubbles, not lasting long,
one should practice good conduct, for the benefit of both this and future lives.
Seeing the karmic retribution in the world, and the fall of the gods,
if one delights in negligence, they will certainly have little happiness.
The noose of karma is extremely long, firm, and difficult to escape,
binding the foolish, far from enlightenment.
Wisdom is like a sharp sword, able to cut through that,
free from the distress of delusion, leading to the other shore.
Due to karma, one receives its fruits, in accordance with good and evil,
The wise do not forget for a moment, cause and effect are always certain.
Due to the combination of causes and conditions, the limbs and bones are born,
Entangling all sentient beings, cycling without liberation.
Because of being entangled, the oppression is difficult to bear,
One should cultivate the causes of liberation, to end all suffering.
That karmic hook is called good, and can also pull sentient beings,
In whatever place one is born, one receives retribution according to one's karma.
That karmic fruit is like a wheel, turning in the three existences,
One should leave all faults and always cultivate superior practices.
Giving is like a pure vessel, storing the water of precepts and diligence,
The wise one skillfully holds and uses it, extinguishing the karmic fire of the three existences.
If one indulges in the three karmas, the three poisons will follow and turn,
Roaming in the three realms, due to the three kinds of deluded actions.
All sentient beings, oppressed by suffering,
All follow their own karma, always relying on it to abide.
If there is no good cause, how can there be a little happiness?
Following karma, one receives its retribution, like a seed producing its fruit.
Also, like in the springtime, it can nourish the plants and trees,
That fruit is born from a cause, without a cause it does not arise.
Bound by the rope of karma, going and returning through hundreds of thousands of lives,
Like a cart wheel in the world, turning by means of a mechanism.
Those three poisons are firm and solid, sentient beings find it difficult to escape,
Free from the faults of greed and so forth, one then well transcends the three existences.
If a person is joyful and happy, cultivating that supreme practice,
For this cause and condition, one receives the superior retribution of adornment.
Karma is like that painter, skillfully depicting various forms,
Either in the heavens or the human realm, the paintings are all complete.
Those paintings are innumerable, all created by the transformation of karma,
Without applying any colored decorations, no one can see them.
When the wall is destroyed, the paintings also disappear, ultimately all scattered and ruined,
Although this body perishes, that karma remains for a long time.
Beings are covered by delusion, bound by karma,
In the beginningless cycle of birth and death, like a potter's wheel constantly turning;
Like wind, sun, and smoke can damage a painting,
The karmic conditions it attracts are never abandoned for a moment.
One should contemplate the unwholesome deeds created in the past,
In every place and situation, one receives the consequences of one's actions.
Whether superior, middling, or inferior, the subtle evil karma,
Able to completely liberate them, he is the supreme knower.
Moreover, those sentient beings create good and bad karma,
In happiness and unhappiness, they will definitely obtain [the results].
If one goes against the Buddha's words, they become foolish people,
For immeasurable suffering, they have no liberation for a long time.
Gods, humans, asuras, hell beings, ghosts, and animals,
All arise from karma, one should follow the path of wisdom.
Due to defiled wisdom and discrimination, one creates immeasurable evil karma,
Each going to various destinies, the retribution is all known and seen.
If a person creates good karma, later they will be reborn in the human realm or heavens,
Non-virtue drowns them in the three evil paths, like an actor changing costumes.
The thread of karma is extremely strong and long, binding the three realms everywhere,
Sentient beings, due to their own karma, are like spokes relying on the rim of a wheel,
Or born among the gods, or sinking into danger and difficulty,
Revolving without a moment's rest, receiving retribution according to karma.
Sentient beings born among the gods, all from good karma obtained,
Like a wonderfully colored lotus flower, emerging from a pure pond.
If a person creates good karma, it is definitely not destroyed,
Always born in a superior place, receiving the fruits as one wishes.
The foolish do not cultivate causes, yet vainly hope for pleasant rewards,
Like seeking butter from sand, it cannot be obtained.
If one cultivates those good causes, then one is born in happiness,
Obtaining retribution without a cause, like seeking fruit apart from a tree.
Because of karma, sentient beings receive retribution without certainty,
Like throwing sand into the air, drifting and falling with the wind.
The causes and conditions of that gathering and dispersing, suffering and happiness are also like this,
All are due to the pulling of karma, one should not create offenses.
The seeds of boundless karma transform in the six paths,
All arise from the mind, this is the Buddha's true teaching.
This mind is difficult to subdue, it delights in creating various karmas,
Like painting various beings, only the Buddha can know and see.
Like a single grain seed can produce hundreds of thousands,
The net of karma is also like this, no one can fathom it.
Like a bird bound by a string, though it soars it can still reach,
That karma binds sentient beings, coming and going is also like this.
Foolish people lack right views, they do not understand the characteristics of offenses and blessings,
Circulating in the three realms of existence, only suffering belongs to them.
If one understands good and evil karma, one will realize the Dharma of arising and ceasing,
This is a true person, who can reach the other shore.
If one is separated from good spiritual friends, one will associate with bad friends,
Abandoning the Dharma and greedily pursuing worldly wealth, not believing in the consequences of suffering in the future,
Because of not understanding the retribution of karma, one will not know what is virtuous and what is sinful.
Those foolish sentient beings will long suffer from distress,
Worldly wisdom gives rise to arrogance, always speaking meaningless words,
Not understanding the causes and conditions of karma, always experiencing the suffering of cyclic existence.
Just as a person who has been imprisoned for a long time, suddenly gains release,
Their relatives and friends rejoice and console each other.
Just as one who is in hell, when their karma is exhausted, gains liberation,
By the power of their previous good karma, they are reborn in the heavens.
Experiencing the pleasures of the heavens, endowed with immeasurable adornments,
There, they cultivate causes again, and are reborn in even more excellent places.
If they do not cultivate goodness, when their karma is exhausted, they will fall back down,
When the signs of decline appear before them, they are like lamps extinguished when the oil is exhausted;
Here they cease, and there they are reborn, cycling through the three realms,
Blown by the winds of karma, how can they escape?
If a person's wisdom is sovereign, they will not be attached to saá¹ƒsÄra,
And will not be bound by the ropes of karma, not even a little bit.
Even if lotus fibers were accumulated to the extent of Mount Sumeru,
Those ropes of karma are also like that, unable to bind the wise.
The wise dwell in saá¹ƒsÄra, unshaken like Mount Sumeru,
Far from all worries and sorrows, liberated from all fears.
As seen by the buddhas, cause and effect are always similar;
If one's actions are vast, their retribution is also the same.
Repeatedly creating various actions, each one receives its fruit,
Due to creating in this way, one is bound by them.
If one creates wholesome karma, one will definitely obtain its superior rewards,
With form, strength, life, and an adorned body, one will be respected by others.
How can merit last long? It is like the light of a lamp,
The retribution of that karma is without error, all following the mind's creation.
All sentient beings, when their karma is exhausted, their lives will surely be lost,
The body is burned by fire, without the slightest comfort.
Moreover, those sentient beings, due to the distinctions in the realm of the mind,
Each creates various karmas, bound by the three existences.
In the world, those who are mute and dumb, due to practicing unwholesome ways,
They hope for pleasant rewards, like stirring water to seek fire.
If one does not create wholesome karma, the fruit of happiness will not arise,
Those who always delight in negligence will definitely lack merit.
Dragged by the rope of karma, dull and ignorant, without awareness,
The bonds cannot be severed, and one is only liberated when suffering ends.
Due to karma, sentient beings go back and forth in the cycle of rebirth,
Seeing this one cease and that one arise, all are obtained from causes.
Foolish people are attached to the five desires, never giving rise to awareness,
Because of mutually supporting craving and love, how can the edge of suffering be reached?
Foolish people are insatiable, delighting in creating various desires,
Because of their insatiable nature, they bring about their own decline.
In this present life of blessings and rewards, when karma is exhausted, joy also disappears,
Because of much indulgence, only at the end of life do they begin to realize.
Giving rise to innumerable discriminations, creating various karmas,
Each according to the causes and conditions of karma, and thus receiving its fruits and retributions.
Sentient beings are driven by karma, either driven by karma or summoned by karma,
Either giving rise to happiness, or summoning a painful retribution.
If one is born in the heavens, one experiences the wonderful pleasures of the five desires,
But when merit is exhausted and one falls back, there is no one who can save one from this.
Moreover, the causes of that cyclic existence all arise from falsehood,
The Buddha, with his true insight, shows the correct path to liberation.
In the past, one cultivated various wholesome actions, in accord with precepts, concentration, and wisdom,
This is not a cause for cyclic existence, but abides in pure bliss.
This karmic retribution is inexhaustible, one should not be negligent,
One should ultimately single-mindedly increase the cultivation of superior practices.
If a person possesses karmic rewards, they should distance themselves from all that is unwholesome,
Doing good leads to the path of sages, doing evil brings about misfortune.
If a person performs wholesome actions, being courageous and not retreating,
They will always attain the bliss of tranquility and be able to enter the path to enlightenment.
If a person is attached to negligence and delights in doing all that is unwholesome,
Their merit will then decrease, and they will fall into evil paths.
This karma is like a swing, all transformed by the mind.
Beings are deceived by delusion and always rely on it to turn.
Birth and death are like a wheel, with the twelve sense bases as spokes.
Spinning in the world, all are controlled by the mind.
By the mind creating good karma, one is led to rebirth as a god.
Confused by objects, one does not contemplate future suffering.
Regarding pleasure and displeasure, one should carefully consider and act.
Although suffering and pleasure arise from different causes and conditions, they all arise from causes and conditions.
There is no pleasure in the world, all are pulled by karma.
When pleasure ends and suffering appears, it is created by the mind.
Beings are blown by the wind of karma to the place of their rebirth.
They give rise to attachment there, and are then bound by karma.
always following one in the next world,ğŸ”½just like when picking flowers,
the fragrance then follows.
Beings are driven by their own karma, following birth and death, transmigrating,
like a swing, rising and falling without rest.
In the heavens, among humans, asuras, and the six destinies, going and returning,
covered by delusion, not giving rise to true insight.
Also like a wheel in the world, turning based on the hands,
driven by karma, swift and unparalleled.
Bound by karma, the twelve factors combine,
this is called the wheel of dependent origination, the world has no knower.
The gods, covered by delusion, always attached to objects of desire,
only the fruits of karma endure, their pleasures are not accumulated.
They do not know good karma, like good medicine and a bright lamp,
Eliminating darkness and attaining lightness and comfort, it can be a refuge and savior.
Undergoing difficulties and enduring extreme suffering, as well as various fears,
This karma has great power, yet it does not give rise to fatigue.ğŸ”½When the heavens perish, one is born among humans; when humans die, they fall into hell;
Leaving hell, they become animals; they then fall into the realm of hungry ghosts.
All due to that karmic wind, they are blown and turned without stability,
Those foolish beings never give rise to awareness.
Beings ride the chariot of karma, able to travel through the three realms,
Other vehicles are not like this, there is no similarity in speed.
If what is done is pure, then one will receive its blessed rewards,
Only in that present life will one know one's own karma.
That karma is like painting, all arising from the mind,
What is painted is not incomplete, lasting for a long time without disappearing.
That is to say, vast and great blessings and rewards all arise from karma.
When the blessings and virtues are exhausted, that happiness will be scattered and destroyed.
If one does not neglect goodness, that happiness will increase and grow.
Therefore, one should gradually cultivate goodness and virtue.
In those hundreds of thousands of lives, one receives a body with bones and joints,
Bound by karma, one never has the thought of peace and happiness.
If one creates various causes, one will receive various rewards.
One should diligently cultivate all good practices in this life.
The paintings of karma are extremely skillful, all created by the mind.
When karma is exhausted, the fruit will also perish, not remaining for a moment.
Only one's own karma is one's relative, what can one obtain from others?
One should skillfully tame one's mind and abide in accordance with principle.
Adorning oneself with karma is not done by others,
For hundreds of lifetimes, thousands of lifetimes, never abandoning it for a moment.
If one understands birth and cessation, and the true causes and effects,
Then one will be free from all sinful defilements and attain the place of non-extinction.
All the karmic actions one creates, winding and twisting, always follow one,
Like spokes relying on the wheel, revolving in the world.
One should discern with wisdom and cultivate in accordance with the principles,
This is the tamer, forever free from all afflictions.
Namely, the defilements of greed, hatred, and delusion, as well as the sufferings of old age, sickness, and death,
These six are like deep enemies, able to harm all sentient beings.
Moreover, the five sense objects are like thieves, able to plunder the wealth of merit,
At first like close friends, later becoming enemies.
Because the mind gives rise to negligence, recklessly pursuing the objects of desire,
It can cause sentient beings to go to the hells and the realm of hungry ghosts.
Greed is like a raging fire, and anger is like an enemy,
while darkness is said to be delusion, and these three are all terrifying.
Namely, the thirty-six karmas and their forty practices,
and the ninety-eight afflictions pervade the three realms.
Free from the twelve links of dependent origination and the one hundred and eight afflictions,
one will always attain immeasurable bliss by skillfully understanding right and wrong dharmas.
In the sixteen kinds of realization and the sixteen kinds of emptiness,
understanding the two aspects of self and dharmas is called being a wise one.
Skillfully understanding the right and wrong paths, as well as the four ends,
liberating oneself from the four torrents, one can extinguish all sinful defilements.
Cultivating the eightfold noble path, one escapes the two kinds of birth and death,
manifesting the ten powers, and attaining the fruit of enlightenment.
Illuminating the two truths of the ultimate and the conventional, as well as the four establishments of mindfulness,
Except for the ignorance of the three periods of time, one will not be subdued by demons.
These five desires and objects of the senses are sweet at first but bitter in the end,
Causing one to fall into various dangers and difficulties, therefore one should always stay far away from them.
Using right wisdom to contemplate and subdue and eliminate all afflictions,
This is called a person with wisdom, who is always at peace in every life.
Wisdom can cut off all delusions, just as fire burns dry firewood,
If right wisdom increases and illuminates, it causes the Three Jewels to manifest.
If one delights in the realm of wisdom and always abides in the Dharma of tranquility,
Afflictions are like poisonous snakes and can harm all that is good.
If one possesses true insight, one can benefit oneself and others,
Free from the faults of old age and death, abiding in the supreme tranquility.
If one delights in saá¹ƒsÄra, one will always be bound by it,
This is the enemy of afflictions, pervading the three realms of existence and oppressing [beings].
If one knows the Buddha's teachings and expounds them for sentient beings,
Always cultivating pure practices, one can be reborn in the Brahma Heaven.
If one is disgusted with the three poisons and always makes offerings to the Buddhas,
One can destroy the cycle of rebirth, like burning dry wood.
If one knows the causes of suffering and does not create any offenses,
The mass of immeasurable afflictions will be unable to bind one.
Wisdom is the supreme light, while delusion is the utmost darkness;
If one can skillfully discriminate, this is called a wise one.
If one is free from the faults of delusion, then there are no dangers;
If one is covered by delusion, how can one attain liberation?
One should rather touch a raging fire or a poisonous snake and live together with them,
Skillfully seeking the bliss of tranquility, one should not be together with delusion.
Foolish people lack right wisdom, like the blind in darkness,
Not fearing the cycle of rebirth, they constantly engage in unwholesome actions.
Beings are deceived by delusion, constantly giving rise to attachment,
Experiencing poverty in the world, oppressed by old age and decline.
Due to the fruits of karma in the three times, one is born in the heavens from the hells,
Or from the heavens one falls into the animal realm, or experiences the retribution of hungry ghosts;
Beings, due to their greed, follow karma to the various destinies,
And are again bound by the snare of delusion, cycling in the ocean of the three existences.
From beginningless [time] they have committed offenses, experiencing various births and deaths,
Due to their habitual tendencies, they have never become weary.
The heavens are harmed by pleasure, the human world suffers from lack,
The hells are constantly burning, the animals devour each other,
The hungry ghosts are oppressed by hunger and thirst - all due to their delusion,
Dwelling long in the cycle of rebirth, how have they ever had any joy?
Foolishly attached to sensual pleasures, one experiences suffering due to pleasure,
Not approaching good spiritual friends, without the true Dharma to rescue and protect.
If a person is endowed with truth, always delights in hearing the true Dharma,
Cultivating various meditative absorptions, he will then have no worries or suffering.
The Buddhas proclaim the true Dharma, like a lamp always illuminating,
With loving thoughts for all beings, surpassing even that of parents.
Beings, due to three causes, create three kinds of faults,
Circulating within the three realms, the three feelings always follow.
Arising from the three karmas, one goes to the three evil and perilous difficulties,
Because beings are attached to pleasure, they gallop through the three existences.
If one respects the Three Jewels, one will attain the three kinds of enlightenment,
Far from the three kinds of views, one will not give rise to various sufferings.
In their days and nights, they always observe the three periods of time,
Namely, old age, sickness, and death, the three kinds of faults and afflictions.
The three karmas are free from wrong thoughts, well abiding in the three equalities,
Not attached to the cycle of birth and death, forever free from all worries and troubles.
Regarding the path and the non-path, as well as the characteristics of emptiness and existence,
With a compassionate mind, skillfully observe, and you will realize the unsurpassed path.
This person's mind is pure, not touching any defilements,
Forever free from all impurities, attaining the bliss of liberation.
Free from craving for the three existences, always giving rise to right mindfulness,
This person on the right path will definitely not regress.
Sentient beings are obscured by delusion, not penetrating wisdom,
Giving rise to immeasurable craving, always bound by suffering.
Lazy, shameless, and close to bad friends,
Are seeds for hell, which the wise should skillfully guard against.
Due to their lack of shame and conscience, they constantly commit various offenses,
Later falling into perilous paths, only to give rise to regret and distress.
Giving rise to arrogance, anger, jealousy, and resentment,
Ignorant and lacking the root of faith, how can they be born in the good realms?
Fond of alcohol and greedy for wealth, giving rise to wrong views and false speech,
Constantly engaging in causes of harsh poison, they will certainly invite the retribution of hell.
Wrong views obstruct all goodness, one should not give rise to even a little bit,
Such ignorant people throw themselves into perilous and evil paths.
That is to say, those who give rise to wrong views, without cause, reckon there is a cause,
They deceive themselves, sinking and drowning without hope of escape.
If a person is attached to wrong views, in vain cultivating their ascetic practices,
Deceiving others, the ignorant give rise to arrogance.
Due to the darkness of ignorance, drowning in the great ocean of birth and death,
This person has no correct cause, wanting to abandon suffering with suffering.
Following the teachings of those non-Buddhists, burning the body to seek liberation,
The wise one causes the mind to be burned, then able to burn away all afflictions.
If one possesses correct wisdom, able to destroy all afflictions,
This is called a true man, attaining liberation from the end of all suffering.
Delighting in worldly fame and praise, while flattering and praising each other,
That pure bodhi, is not attained by wrong views.
Not diligently cultivating goodness, the mind always gives rise to agitation,
Because of greedily clinging to offerings, abandoning that pure morality.
Delighting in and clinging to the taste of alcohol, delighting in harming others,
Killing all sentient beings, thereby falling into hell.
Associating with evil friends, giving rise to wrong views and divisive speech,
Not attaining any dignified conduct, the three karmas often violate and transgress.
Due to the ignorance of self-conceit, what is said lacks truth,
In this world and in other lives, how can one attain happiness?
Submerged by various sufferings, this ends and that arises again,
As taught by the Buddhas, all are due to ignorance and karmic formations.
If a person gives rise to self-conceit, wrong conceit, and conceit of superiority,
This is the root of suffering, which should be permanently and completely abandoned.
Delighting in creating various evils, without goodness in the beginning, middle, or end,
Following that current of ignorance, one enters the great ocean of birth and death.
If a person possesses supreme wisdom and skillfully eliminates afflictions,
Able to untie all bonds, one can reach the place of non-extinction.
By cultivating supreme wisdom, one can then cut off all delusions,
This is said to be the bondage of afflictions, which is liberated by wisdom.
All afflictions are like firewood, burned and completely exhausted by the fire of wisdom,
If one delights in sense objects, how can one be free from entanglements?
The five desires are a heavy miasma, able to cover the eye of wisdom,
Always causing sentient beings to destroy the right path of expounding the Dharma.
One should single-mindedly listen attentively to the one who expounds the Dharma well,
This person is a leader in the Dharma, able to confront the armies of MÄra.
That is to say, regarding the four inverted views and the eight worldly dharmas,
If one does not give rise to right wisdom oneself, one will be deceived by them.
The five desires are like a swift-flowing current, difficult to escape from being swept away,
One should use the raft of wisdom to be able to cross over them.
Because of their deluded mind, they always delight in and cling to desires,
Revolving in the five destinies, how can they attain liberation?ğŸ”½Improper attention is like fire always blazing,
If one acts in accordance with principle, like nectar it removes heat.
It is said that the accumulation of ignorance arises from the distant past,
With a single lamp of wisdom, it is destroyed and made to disappear.
If a person possesses right wisdom, they can then enter nirvana,
Without wisdom, indulging in greed and delusion, then laziness arises.
If one possesses the light of wisdom, destroying the darkness of the three poisons,
Therefore, one should single-mindedly uphold the precepts and cultivate pure wisdom.
Always using the great wisdom fire to burn the firewood of afflictions,
If one lacks this wholesome root, one will be harmed by the three poisons.
Beings are bound by chronic illness, lying down at the end of their lives,
Confused and without support, their relatives merely grieve in vain.
Due to much indulgence, always delighting in foolish conduct,
It becomes the cause of immeasurable evil, and one experiences the oppression of various sufferings.
The harm of these three poisons afflicts all beings,
If one is associated with right wisdom, all of that is eliminated.
One should know that the fire of wisdom can burn the mountain of afflictions,
When delusions and karma are no more, one always abides in the bliss of tranquility.
It is said that due to that thought, one always creates evil offenses,
Foolishly not understanding, one gives rise to regret in vain.
Sentient beings create offenses and all receive painful retributions,
Therefore one should stay far away and always seek blissful results.
Although one may initially create a small offense, later one falls into a dangerous path,
Because delusion covers one's mind, one emerges and then creates again.
Small offenses that are not guarded against all become causes for hell,
Just as a small fire can burn a mountain forest.
Due to offenses one is born in evil destinies and receives extremely heavy suffering,
That is like an enemy to oneself, how can one attain tranquility?
If a person commits various offenses, there will be little joy.
If one seeks joy and happiness, one should cultivate various wholesome practices.
Doing good is praised as excellent, while creating evil is despised by all.
Cultivating blessings is indeed difficult, but committing offenses is easy.
If one sees the creation of unwholesome actions and gives rise to a lowly mind of approval,
Because of their lack of wisdom, the suffering they experience will be even greater than this.
If a person creates many offenses, accumulating various karmic fruits,
This suffering is difficult to bear, so one should not do evil.
Because of creating many offenses, one will definitely experience their evil consequences.
Therefore, one should stay far away from them; if one does not create them, there will be no fault.
If one is not afraid of various offenses, one will become close to bad friends.
Because of creating them oneself, one will experience the consequences, not someone else.
Practicing good leads to good results, while creating evil leads to experiencing evil consequences.
If one commits various offenses, there will be no goodness.
If a person is attached to wrong views, they will continue to create offenses.
Even with swords, clubs, fire pits, there is nothing comparable to that.
If a person is free from various evils and always cultivates good conduct,
with pure body, speech, and mind, they are not far from enlightenment.
If one delights in creating various offenses, they will experience extremely heavy suffering and distress.
It is not because of creating offenses that one can obtain pleasant results.
If one delights in cultivating various good deeds, they will attain the highest bliss.
This goodness is not the cause of suffering, and there is no one who experiences it in an inverted manner.
From beginningless eons, creating goodness results in the reward of happiness.
If one creates the cause of evil, they will definitely obtain the result of suffering.
Associating with good friends who do good deeds, and befriending evil friends who create offenses,
hating and envying virtuous people, they will fall into the evil paths.
If the mind delights in cultivating goodness, it will stay far from all evil.
For such a person, enlightenment is not far, like the palm of one's hand.
That is to say, in one's practice, the beginning, middle, and end are all good,
Able to give rise to pleasant karmic fruits, abandoning this is not so.
Therefore, stay far from all evil, and let goodness always continue,
Those who can leave behind that evil will always obtain happiness.
In beginningless birth and death, one repeatedly experiences various evils,
The foolish are driven by delusion, and do not give rise to weariness.
Attached to desires, one creates various evils, not knowing the bitter fruits to come,
For a while, one gives rise to satisfaction, but for a long time one experiences suffering and distress.
Those who delight in creating evil are despised by the world,
Therefore, leave behind all evil, and do not let goodness be neglected.
Useless and not ultimate, one experiences the most supreme suffering and distress,
Therefore, the wise always stay far away from wrongdoing.
If a person is full of loving-kindness, they will not create any offenses.
Doing evil brings misfortune upon oneself; if not done, it will not be experienced.
Always creating evil offenses, relying on false teachers and false teachings,
If one is free from these two, one will abide well in the true path.
Foolish people do not realize this and enjoy creating all kinds of evil deeds.
If one is free from these faults, one will always be reborn in superior places.
If one enjoys creating many offenses, one will definitely be dragged around by karma.
Not fearing the future of cyclic existence, the human body is difficult to obtain.
If a person fears offenses, they will enjoy creating much goodness.
They will be able to proceed to enlightenment and attain the most sublime bliss.
If one can be free from faults and cultivate all wholesome actions,
This person will obtain the foremost blessings and rewards in the world.
Well subduing the senses, respected by the world,
At the end of this one life, one is reborn in the heavens.
If a person has little merit and virtue, with no goodness in the beginning, middle, or end,
Evil and wrongdoing constantly increase, then one falls into hell.
If one creates various offenses, one invites their evil consequences.
Doing good as one sees it, one will definitely experience the reward of happiness.
Due to unwholesome seeds, one is later born in a difficult and dangerous place,
Just as one's past actions were, the causes and effects are all similar.
Sentient beings falling into evil destinies are all summoned by offenses,
Like a fish swallowing a hook, there is no way to escape.
Offenses are the root of suffering, they should be ultimately eliminated and severed,
Sentient beings are always tainted and habituated, like a vessel following impurity.
What should always be practiced and delighted in is able to destroy all evil karma,
It is like pressing sesame seeds, the flowers are destroyed but the fragrance does not dissipate.
Always delighting in the five desires, distracted and impatient,
Lazy and speaking falsely, they definitely have no goodness.
If one creates many evils, it is like a long night of darkness,
If one abides in wholesome dharmas, it is like the rising sun.
If a person is free from jealousy, this is a pure practice,
Fools create many offenses, they are always angry.
Like a boat carrying few goods, it can float wherever it goes,
If a sentient being's offenses are light, they will avoid sinking into evil.
Far from evil friends, one always obtains all kinds of happiness,
If one follows them, one will experience all kinds of dangers and difficulties.
Well understanding karmic retribution, free from subtle transgressions,
This person is not attached to offenses, like space not tainted by mud.
Those who have not heard will hear, and having heard, they will be able to remember.
